intro: Nigella atropurpurea, commonly known as black cumin or Persian licorice, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, branching stems that grow up to 60 cm in height, covered with fine hairs. The plant produces small, spherical seed pods that turn from green to a dark brownish-purple as they mature. Its flowers are typically pale blue or purple, arranged in loose clusters at the tips of the stems. The seeds are rich in essential oils and have been used for their aromatic and medicinal properties for centuries.
